titleStmt.title: The tell-troth's reqvitall, or, Truth's recompence as it was preached the 12th day of November, 1626, at Eckington: wherein are contained these three propositions, (vindicating Paul from the aspersion of enmity, and laying it on the Galatians,) viz. 1 No grace of God in man can secure him from the enmity of the unregenerate. 2 Sometimes a ministers owne hearers are set in variance against him. 3 The publication of the truth is the cause of this variance. By Samuel Kenrick student in divinity, and preacher of Gods word in the same place.
titleStmt.author: Kenrick, Samuel, b. 1602 or 3.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Miles Flesher for Robert Mylbourne, and are to be sold at the great south doore of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery, San Marino, California.

place.placeName: the great south doore of Pauls
